revised_title: Organic Remains Found Near Brentford, Middlesex: An Overview
tldr: This article discusses the discovery of various organic remains, including bones, teeth, and shells, found in two fields near Brentford, Middlesex. The remains were discovered during the digging of soil for brickmaking. The author describes the different layers of soil and their contents, noting the presence of fossils from both marine and freshwater organisms, as well as land animals like elephants, hippos, and deer. The author also mentions the blue clay stratum, which contains many marine fossils and is prevalent in London and its surroundings.
